data.title: A wee bit of the Olde Country in Erie PA
data.text:
We hit her mid afternoon.Although the Reuben Sandwich did not originate in Ireland, the make a good one here. The kitchen has a good balance of the dressing for me. Many leave it too dry.
The corned beef and cabbage was in itself, a wonderful meal for two. I do not recall the sides we had, but only the coleslaw was a little bland.

The Guinness bar and imported woodwork (claimed) were fantastic. I take their word as authentic, but even if not, the interior is fantastic. Strategically placed mirrors mad the whole place seem bigger and brighter than it seemed to be from the outside.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: Downtown Erie has few nice places to eat, but this is great for pub grub. Irish pub atmosphere with nice beer selection. The table service system seems a bit chaotic as we were never really sure who was serving our table.  However they all were welcoming and friendly. The menu includes some traditional Irish dishes, and half portions are available at a generous size and decent price. Surprised but delighted to see Happy Hour for drinks on a Saturday night.

data.title: Good local watering hole
data.text: Visited Erie, PA for an overnight trip and based on the reviews, decided to go to Molly Brannigans.  Very good hamburger and local brews for happy hour.  But, the place was kinda very quite...I guess that's to be expected on a Thursday late evening in downtown Erie, PA.  Our server, though not very knowledgeable about the local brews (in her defense, she is a teetotaler...:-)  was very polite. I'd like to go back on a Friday/Saturday evening.

data.title: Good place for lunch
data.text: Great Irish bar for lunch,  offering pick 2 selections at a good price.  The food was good, as was the service. Loved the fact that I got a pot of tea, not just a small cup.

data.title: Very good Irish pub with meat and Guiness
data.text:
Superb Guiness as well as half/half version with cyder ! Wonderful !!!

Very Irish menu, sandwiches and soups and salads, all very Irish flavored.

data.title: Irish Pub
data.text: The restaurant was a typical Irish Pub.  The food was good but nothing outstanding.  Decor was also typical.

data.title: Evening bite
data.text: Wonderful atmosphere. Good food. Good beer. Has Fish and chips. Pretty good. Molly's Red was the beer recommended. Good choice by the waitress.

data.title: Nice
data.text: Good food nice place to eat ,one downfall when we left a homeless man approach ed us asking for money and scaredy husband and i.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Has the best food, nice atmosphere, very friendly. Great prices. Good food, nice place to have dinner.

data.title: Good food, wonderful atmosphere
data.text: A friend and I went there for the first time today. They sat us way in the back which was great because we wanted to visit. The waitress was cute and bubbly, very attentive to our needs. The price was decent too.  I had the chicken strips, fries and coleslaw, my friend had the buffalo chicken wrap...all the food was delicious. The fries were fantastic!!

data.title: Greatest Irish Pub
data.text: A true gem in the Erie, PA restaurant scene. Excellent menu choices far superior to most pub taverns. Great service, location, and prices

data.title: Irish Pub Night
data.text: We stopped in for a quick meal before a concert at the arena.  Love the old style wooden bar with brass railings, large Irish whiskey glass mirrors, wooden floors and pub style design.  We got a high top table against the wall at the half way point of the pub.  The waitress was friendly and nice, refreshing drinks of Crown Royal gingerale, Jack Daniel's with gingerale and they tasted great.  Enjoy a nice meal and went on our way.

data.title: Molly's is Magnificent
data.text: My friend, Rosie and I chose Molly's as our post-Erie Play house dining spot. I have dined there many times since it opened. This was Rosie's first experience. We chose a booth by the front window to have views of passers by as well as the top notch ambience of the restaurant. The wait staff was attentive, offering samples of a few beers we were unfamiliar with-a nice touch when you don't want a full glass of a brew you're not so sure you will enjoy. Rosie's pub burger and my Reuben were out of the ordinary-lots of tender meat, cooked to perfection. The accompanying fries were top quality with the added flavors and crispness of the higher quality available in better restaurants...not blah or ordinary. The atmosphere is filled with authentic Irish touches-the bar itself was shipped from Ireland. The loft has a life-like "knight in armour" watching over patrons. The ceiling is so beautiful-the painting is a touch of heaven....a two sided fireplace adds ambience and offers a great soft chair sitting area. Live fiddle music is a treat to patrons at various times throughout the year. For many years I brought my PRESCHOOL CLASS to Molly's for lunch following the Erie Play house productions....the staffing was so welcoming....we would sit in the balcony to eat....the children were so well behaved and Molly's staff was then and still is among the most attentive in the city of Erie. We purchase the yearly Savearound coupon book which offers a B1G1 coupon for up to $10 off your food purchase.....a nice way to save money to enjoy dessert!

data.title: Lousy with cold fries
data.text: Over cooked burger and cold fries. Terrible! Not going back. Not much good to say. They messed up my husbands sandwich order. All fries to the table were cold.

data.title: Good prices, super delicious, nice atmosphere
data.text: We really liked this pub. The food tasted very very good and the prices were totally ok. But they could have some more vegetarian options.

data.title: Worth the entire trip to Erie!
data.text: We ate dinner here on our day trip to Erie and it was our favorite part of the trip! Excellent food, great service, really cool atmosphere. Would eat here again in a heartbeat!

data.title: Great Irish Pub
data.text:
A group of us stopped in for lunch during Roar on the Shore.  Very friendly staff and great food.  

Everyone truly enjoyed what they ordered, and I am sure we will be back next year!

data.title: Chicken Pesto Gnocchi
data.text: I used to dream about girls... After eating Molly Brannigan's Chicken Pest Gnocchi now I dream about that!

data.title: Nice Comfortable Quaint Irish Pub
data.text: In town for a meeting and a group of six of us went to MBs got dinner. This is an authentic Irish pub with all the furnishings and beverage/food selections. The waitress was very patient and made our visit pleasant.  The food was good for a pub and the folks in our group that ate the Irish dishes were very pleased. Beer selections were large and prices were very reasonable. We enjoyed the visit and when we were leaving a local band began to play so we stayed for a night cap. Erin go bragh!

data.title: Great food
data.text: Real Irish cider to mix w beer. Pork BBQ was delicious, it too was made w the cider.  My husband debated over several menu options and finally chose the fish n chips, which he said was great.
